snippet: Alan Gilbert, the conductor of the New York Philharmonic, halted the orchestra when the cellphone belonging to a member of the audience at Tuesday night’s concert rang and rang and rang.
abstract: Alan Gilbert, the conductor of the New York Philharmonic, halted the orchestra when the cellphone belonging to a member of the audience at Tuesday night’s concert rang and rang and rang.

headline.main: New York Philharmonic Interrupted by Chimes Mahler Never Intended
headline.print_headline: Marimba in Mahler’s Ninth Is a Showstopper
